org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class WrongBucketException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.SegmentIntegrityException
          • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.WrongBucketException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WrongBucketException
extends SegmentIntegrityException
    Thrown by ConcurrentHashMapAuditor.verifyMapIntegrity(boolean, int) to indicate the detection of an entry whose hash code does not match the bucket in which it was found.
    Author:
    David Curtis
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WrongBucketException

        public WrongBucketException(ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe segmentProbe,
                    int bucketIndex,
                    int offset,
                    int bucketIndexFromEntry)
        Creates a new WrongBucketException with the specified details.
        Parameters:
        segmentProbe - proxy for segment in which exception occurred; uses reflection to access private segment internals
        bucketIndex - index of the bucket in which the offending entry was detected
        offset - offset (from the bucket index) of the offending entry
        bucketIndexFromEntry - the bucket index derived from the entry's hash code

    • Method Detail

        Returns:

      • getBucketIndexFromEntry

        public int getBucketIndexFromEntry()

        the bucket index derived from the entry's hash code
